result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquis D. Lewis

records.addlTxt:
4:20 PM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Marquis D. Lewis in court.  Attorney Michelle M. Gardner in court for Marquis D. Lewis. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Matter is resolved and agreement placed on the record by Attorney Gardner. Defendant pleads guilty to count count 2. On State's motion, count 1 is dismissed and read in. Court withholds entry of judgment on count 1and allows a hold open agreement to go forward. 12 month Hold Open Agreement entered into.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 19, 2023 at 01:30 pm. Bond continued.

08:43 AM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Marquis D. Lewis, appeared with Attorney Michelle Gardner.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Gardner advises the Court why the DE did not appear at the last court date. Court vacates the warrant and reinstates bond if it was forfeited.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Attorney Knapp contacted clerk NN to schedule VA for 9/2/22 at 8:30 am. DA notified by email.

09:30 AM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  No appearance by the Defendant. Attorney Michelle M. Knapp appeared on behalf of the Defendant.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Knapp does not have an explanation for why the DE is not present as she has had contact with the DE.  Based on the DE's failure to appear, Court issues a bench warrant w/ a $500.00 cash bond - stayed until 12:00 pm on 9/2/2022.  Cash bond forfeited at that time. Attorney Knapp may contact the clerk to schedule a voluntary appearance.

Minutes:  3:31pm.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Daniel Tombasco appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person along w/Atty Michelle Knapp.  VRC.  Defense counsel reports this case will likely resolve, but deft wishes to review the discovery.  JPTC adj to 8/30/22 @ 8:45am.  No objection by the State.
At the request of Atty Knapp the JPTC of 07/20/22 at 9:00 has been rescheduled to 08/10/22 at 3:30 due to the DE being on vacation.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

CONTINUED POSTED
  PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.

01:35 PM    Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not guilty plea entered by court on behalf of DE.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.  $600  Cash bond continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry).  Cash bond on deposit $600.  ts
and witness list filed by the State  kmk
